feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:56PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels on Interior Rivers... The long stretch of warm temperatures across the Interior continues with glacier melt and snowmelt at higher elevations bringing glacier fed river levels up. The Tanana river continues to run near bankfull to bankfull with some water making its way into low lying areas near the river, and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 08 at 1:53PM AKDT until July 11 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... The potential for abundant lightning continues across the forecast area with 3000 to 6000 lightning strokes a day through Sunday. This will be combined with extremely dry fuels and minimum Relative Humidity values in the 20 to 40 percent range

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 08 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Dallas-Fort Worth area for Saturday, July 9, 2022. Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone air pollution in the Dallas-Fort Worth area

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 08 at 8:02PM CDT until July 09 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 4 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.
